div1.p: Clemons thanks Kean for his comments regarding yellow fever. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from Harry Clemons to Jefferson Randolph Kean, August 15, 1939
div1.p:
I am grateful for the very
interesting comments in your letter of August
tenth. I note that you had yellow fever yourself
in June 1900, and that you were in charge as Health
Officer during ‘the second conquest.’ We are glad
to have the facts about that second conquest on rec-
ord here. It is curious how a flash of publicity
will sometimes throw into obscurity the surrounding
area.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry Clemons Librarian
To Gen. Jefferson R. Kean
2804 N Street, N. W.
Georgetown
Washington, D. C.
